item.title: Lisa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Nobody can tell what I suffer! But it is always so. Those who do not complain are never pitied." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "It is one of life's bitterest truths that bedtime so often arrives just when things are really getting interesting." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Haim G. Ginott
item.description: "I have come to the frightening conclusion that I am the decisive element. It is my personal approach that creates the climate. It is my daily mood that makes the weather. I possess tremendous power to make life miserable or joyous. I can be a tool of torture or an instrument of inspiration, I can humiliate or humor, hurt or heal. In all situations, it is my response that decides whether a crisis is escalated or de-escalated, and a person is humanized or de-humanized. If we treat people as they are, we make them worse. If we treat people as they ought to be, we help them become what they are capable of becoming." -- Haim G. Ginott

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Robert Redford
item.description: "Health food may be good for the conscience but Oreos taste a hell of a lot better." -- Robert Redford

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Sir Thomas More
item.description: "For if you suffer your people to be ill-educated, and their manners to be corrupted from their infancy, and then punish them for those crimes to which their first education disposed them, what else is to be concluded from this, but that you first make thieves and then punish them." -- Sir Thomas More

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Thomas More
item.description: "A pretty face may be enough to catch a man, but it takes character and good nature to hold him." -- Thomas More

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Thomas More
item.description: "We did not ask if he had seen any monsters, for monsters have ceased to be news. There is never any shortage of horrible creatures who prey on human beings, snatch away their food, or devour whole populations; but examples of wise social planning are not so easy to find." -- Thomas More

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Thomas More
item.description: "You wouldn't abandon ship in a storm just because you couldn't control the winds." -- Thomas More

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "The past is behind, learn from it. The future is ahead, prepare for it. The present is here, live it." -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Only you can control your future." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Gibson
item.description:
"The future is already here – it's just not evenly distributed.
<i>The Economist, December 4, 2003</i>" -- William Gibson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "If we could follow the slogan that says,"Turn off the TV and open a good book" we would do something of substance for a future generation." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor H. Porter
item.description: "What men and women need is encouragement. Their natural resisting powers should be strengthened, not weakened ... Instead of always harping on a man's faults, tell him of his virtues. Try to pull him out of his rut ... Hold up to him his better self, his real self that can dare and do and win out! ... People radiate what is in their minds and in their hearts." -- Eleanor H. Porter

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor H. Porter
item.description: "Just breathing isn't living!" -- Eleanor H. Porter

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor H. Porter
item.description: "Oh, yes; the game was to just find something about everything to be glad about—no matter what 'twas" -- Eleanor H. Porter

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor H. Porter
item.description: "Oh, yes," nodded Pollyanna, emphatically. He [her father] said he felt better right away, that first day he thought to count 'em. He said if God took the trouble to tell us eight hundred times [in the Bible] to be glad and rejoice, He must want us to do it - SOME." -- Eleanor H. Porter

item.title: Lisa add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "If you're in trouble, or hurt or need - go to the poor people. They're the only ones that'll help - the only ones." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Marthe Troly-Curtin
item.description: "Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time." -- Marthe Troly-Curtin
